results.title: Besieged
results.creator_credit: Bernardo Bertolucci, Massimo Cortesi and Fiction
results.brief_description: In Rome, reclusive British composer Jason Kinsky lives in the building he inherited from his aunt, while his cleaning woman Shandurai resides in the basement, studying medicine. One day, Kinsky tells Shandurai that he loves her and will do anything for her, so she asks him to free her husband, a political prisoner back in Africa. To acquire funds for the man’s release, Kinsky begins selling his possessions, including his piano. Cast includes: Thandie Newton, David Thewlis and Claudio Santamaria.

results.title: Benny & Joon
results.creator_credit: Jerremiah Chechik, Donna Roth, Susan Arnold and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Benny runs a car repair shop and also look after his mentally ill sister, Joon, who tends to create disturbances when left unattended. After Joon suffers a losing night of poker, Benny must also take in Sam, a friend’s cousin, who has his own share of erratic personality traits. Not surprisingly, Sam and Joon immediately hit it off. As they fall deeper in love, Benny must deal with new feelings of jealousy and of not being needed so much by his sister. Cast includes: Johnny Depp, Mary Stuart Masterson, Aidan Quinn, Julianne Moore and Oliver Platt.

results.title: Beneath Clouds
results.creator_credit: Ivan Sen, Teresa-Jayne Hanlon, AFFC, Australian Film Commission, New South Wales Film and Television Office, SBS Independent and Autumn Films
results.brief_description: Ivan Sen’s debut feature continues the story of one of his acclaimed short films, ‘Tears’. Two disaffected teenagers, Vaughn and Lena (played by non-professional actors Damian Pitt and Dannielle Hall), meet on the road as they flee their troubled backgrounds and head to the city.

constellations_other.name: Setting the record straight
constellations_other.description: For too long, the history of Australia was only told in mainstream films through a white lens. First Nations people have used the camera as a means of truth-telling and setting the record straight for decades.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivan Sen, Teresa-Jayne Hanlon, AFFC, Australian Film Commission, New South Wales Film and Television Office, SBS Independent and Autumn Films
results.description:
Ivan Sen’s debut feature continues the story of one of his acclaimed short films, ‘Tears’. Two disaffected teenagers, Vaughn and Lena (played by non-professional actors Damian Pitt and Dannielle Hall), meet on the road as they flee their troubled backgrounds and head to the city. Lena, a light-skinned Aboriginal who passes as white, is looking for the Irish father she only knows from photographs. Vaughn is on the run from a prison farm, going home to see his dying mother who long ago gave him up. He is angry and prone to violent outbursts, especially against white people. Though uncommunicative and wary of each other, the two develop an uneasy, tentative bond as their journey progresses and they encounter various Indigenous and European Australians. With extremely sparse dialogue and little character development, Sen uses visual language to convey the emotional isolation of the pair who are often framed in long shot against the open vistas of the Northern New South Wales rural landscape (shot around Moree), or in extreme close-ups. The chasm between black and white Australia and a continuing history of brutality against Indigenous Australians are underlying themes that run through the film.

Written by Ivan Sen; photography, Allan Collins; music, Alister Spence and Ivan Sen; editing, Karen Johnson.

results.title: Bells are ringing
results.creator_credit: Vincente Minnelli, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Judy Holliday reprises her stage role of switchboard operator Ella Peterson at the Susanswerphone company run by her cousin, Sue (Jean Stapleton). Ella has an uncanny knack of becoming involved with the lives of the Manhattan clients she services. One client in particular, a playboy writer know only as Plaza 0-4433 (Dean Martin), has developed a curious relationship with Ella, confiding in a faceless voice that he imagines belongs to a little old lady, not knowing that the young Ella has fallen in love with the voice at the end of the line. The police are suspicious of the Susanswerphone company and think its the front for a house of ill repute, thus Ella is also shadowed by a dim witted police official determined to get the real story. His pursuit of Ella blinds him to the fact that there is a real criminal on the loose (Eddie Foy Jnr), who poses as a record executive and uses the names of famous composers as a secret code for racetracks around the continent. Being the dedicated switchboard operator that she is, Ella takes it upon herself to protect the privacy of her clients from police scrutiny and delivers the messages in person (incognito of course). Thus she gets to meet Plaza 0-4433, aka Jeffrey Moss, in the flesh, and just in the nick of time too, saving him from wallowing in alcoholism because he can’t come up with an idea for a play. Romance blossoms between Ella and Jeffrey, but can it survive based on lies, and how will Ella reconcile her two personas? This was Holliday’s final film appearance. Adapted from a Broadway musical by Betty Comden, Adolph Green and Jule Styne.

results.title: Belle de Jour
results.creator_credit: Luis Bunuel, Raymond Hakim, Betty Edmonds, Robert Edmonds, Five Films and Paris Film
results.brief_description: Catherine Deneuve plays a beautiful young woman married to a rich young surgeon (Jean Sorel). Their life is a material success but the wife’s frigidity is a strain on the marriage. Plagued by masochistic sexual fantasies, she takes a part-time job in a brothel, hoping that by playing the part of Belle de Jour, the high class prostitute, she can overcome her dislike for sex. This is a savagely funny, and often a very cruel film, as it pulls apart the consumerist psyche of a bourgeois woman to reveal her as souless and empty of life. Stripped of her clothes, her jewellery, her status, she is a no-one. It is only as Belle de Jour that she can emotionally experience life. The movie moves back and forth from the casual filmwork of the brothel scenes to the surrealist dream sequences where Belle de Jour recieves the punishments she feels she deserves. Though often criticised as a misogynist film, it is not women who are the target of Bunuel’s satire, but the pretensions of wealth and status. Nor is the sexuality of men sacred for Bunuel as some of the funniest sequences deal with the absurdities of masculine desire. Co-starring Michel Piccoli and Genevieve Page. Based on the novel by Jospeh Kessel.

results.title: Beautiful thing
results.creator_credit: Hettie Macdonald, Bill Shapter, Tony Garnett and Channel Four Television
results.brief_description: Teenager Jamie Gangel (Glenn Berry) shares a council flat in South London with his extroverted but warm hearted bar tender mother, Sandra (Linda Henry). Jamie is a quiet and introverted student, victimised by his school mates for being a homosexual, and frustrated by his mother in yet another relationship. On either side of them live Jamie’s abused school mate Ste (Scott Neal), and the delinquent, Mother Cass afficionado, Leah (Tameka Empson). When Ste runs to the Gangel’s after another bout of abuse he finds himself sharing a room with Jamie, and soon begins to question his sexual identity when Jamie reveals that he is queer. In the small confines of the council flats the close knit neighbourhood find out as much about themselves as the new relationship that’s going on separated by the thin fibro walls.

results.title: Beautiful girls
results.creator_credit: Ted Demme, Cary Woods, Woods Entertainment and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: A ten year high school reunion in a snowbound town is the setting for this exploration of how men’s lives are influenced by “beautiful girls”. Piano playing Willie (Hutton), former heartthrob Tommy (Dillon), his girlfriend Sharon (Sorvino), and his lover Darian (Holly) all gather with long lost friends for reminiscing and advice about relationships. Out of the group of friends, only Willie has moved away from the small New England town and is pursuing a career as a piano player. He is at a crossroads in his life, contemplating giving up his career for girlfriend Tracy (Annabeth Gish). His feelings are complicated by the presence of a captivating young girl next door (Natalie Portman).

results.title: Bean
results.creator_credit: Mel Smith, Tim Evans, Eric Fellner, Peter Bennett-Jones, NV Polygrams S A and PolyGram Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: In an attempt to get rid of their most inept and detested employee, Mr Bean, The Royal National Gallery of London send him to America to oversee the unveiling of America’s most treasured painting, ‘Whistler’s mother’. The staff of the Grierson Gallery in Los Angeles are not privy to the gallery’s rationale for sending Mr Bean, and still believe that they are dealing with a man of the finest intellect, the scholarly Dr Bean. While in America Mr Bean is billetted to stay with David Langley (Peter MacNicol), much to the annoyance of his family who seriously doubt his supposedly brilliant credentials. As Mr Bean unleashes his particular brand of behaviour, which inevitably ends in disaster, they too begin to wonder about the enigmatic Mr Bean. The most significant of his disasters includes destroying ‘Whistlers’ mother’, forcing him into panic mode to rectify the situation before he gives a speech at the grand unveiling. Cast also includes Mel Smith, Pamela Reed and Harris Yulin. Includes 20 minutes of unseen footage as well as interviews with Rowan Atkinson and Mel Smith.

results.title: Battleship Potemkin (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This renowned Soviet feature portrays the mutiny aboard the Russian battleship Potemkin and the role of the sailors and citizens of the Port of Odessa in the abortive revolution of 1905. An epic dramatisation, it brought to the attention of the world the theories of Sergei Eisenstein, his emphasis on montage, stress on intellectual content and his treatment of the mass instead of the individual as protagonist.

results.title: Battleground
results.creator_credit: William Wellman, Dore Schary and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: It is the dead of winter and GIs are dug in near the strategic crossroads of Bastogne. They are surrounded, outnumbered and bombarded with a steady barrage of incoming fire. Ammunition is low and it looks as if the fog will never lift. The Germans, sensing victory, demand surrender - and receive a strong reply from the American commander. Winner of the Best Screenplay and Best Cinematography Academy Awards, this movie is a landmark portrait of triumph under fire dedicated to the honour all soldiers and resonates with the humour, fear and bravery of civilian soldiers put to the test in the greatest conflict the world has ever known.
